nodes.bodyText:
Have a question. if I understand correctly, the deleted code was relying on eager loading but prevents deleting content when stripping it out before serialization.
removeSourceFilesFromEntry seems to save the current state and then do the eviction. But why is a eviction no longer needed here specifically? Is it because lazy loading causes the source files to not be serialized anyway?

With my changes, the sourcefiles are not always lazily loaded. When you refresh an entry or edit a hosted one, the sourcefiles end up getting loaded, so that's why I created the new function to remove the sourcefiles. But the sourcefiles aren't loaded whenever stripContent() was called.

Can you add a comment to the method explaining what is going on here? If I knew Hibernate better, I might understand. But I don't. I sort of see what's happening, but I don't think I grok all the details.

Added just the comment for now. Tried doing just the first suggestion, but ran into some issues when implementing
the new getFileDAO function in this file https://github.com/dockstore/dockstore/blob/feature/3712/lazyLoadSourcefiles/dockstore-webservice/src/main/java/io/openapi/api/impl/ToolsApiServiceImpl.java
Doesn't seem simple to fix after talking to Charles.
@denis-yuen do you have comment on whether these suggestions should be done?

I don't have a preference as to whether the query should be in EntryDAO, but not really a hibernate expert.
(I think there can be whole careers in this space)
I agree that it would be nice to avoid passing FileDAO everywhere but I don't feel strongly about it if it seems very problematic.
Sorry, probably less enlightening than hoped
